alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson and northeastern Washington Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Chipley, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Graceville, Cottondale, Campbellton, Richter Crossroads, Jacob City, Cottondale Airport, Jacobs, Browntown, Bahoma, Ellaville, Sills and Steele City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
